data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
***\*Please note that this class is a multi-week course. This class will be presented in 4 iterations over 5 weeks, with one week off.\****

This is a four-session course recurring on Wednesdays from 6-9 PM. Students will gain familiarity with all aspects of tracking a band and delivering a mixed product. Online resources will accompany the in-person sessions, so participants can gain familiarity with the professional audio software REAPER. Upon completion of the course, students should have a basic understanding of Vera studio operations and are eligible to rent the space after a competency test.

The class dates are as follows:

- Wed, February 4, 6-9 PM
- Wed, February 11, 6-9 PM
- \*NO CLASS on Wednesday February 17\*
- Wed, February 25, 6-9 PM
- Wed, March 4, 6-9 PM

bundles.name: Open Sessions
bundles.description: Screen Print Open Sessions at The Vera Project's studio

data.age_limit: This is an All Ages event.
data.raw_description:
**\*You MUST take the SP 101: Intro to Vera's Screen Print Studio class before you can sign up for an Open Session\***

Vera’s screen print studio offers four-hour Open Sessions where individuals who have completed the introductory class may use our screen print lab to work on their own projects. Our Open Sessions are looked over by a volunteer moderator, who can provide you with advice and guidance for anything taught in our Screen Printing 101 class. We offer three different kinds of tickets at Open Sessions: Vacuum Table for paper and other flat media, T-shirt Press for shirts, tote bags and other fabrics, and Screen prep for just screen preparation. Each ticket is limited to two. If the ticket you are looking for is sold out, please add yourself to the waitlist so you can be notified when a ticket becomes available.

For Open Sessions, Vera provides:

- Rentable screens
- Emulsion and emulsion remover
- Squegees
- Basic tools like spatulas, rulers, tape, etc.

Participants must provide their own:

- Substrate (paper, t-shirts, etc)
- Water based ink

Vera *does not* allow the use of non-water based inks at our studio, as our studio is not set up to safely process non-water based ink.

If you have any questions, please email matt@theveraproject.org.

**FAQ**

1\. Can Vera print a transparent stencil for me?

Yes — You must send us your stencil at least 24 hours before the start of your session. Your file must be a .PDF, no larger than 12" x 18", and ready to print. Vera cannot make any edits to your file. Stencils are $5 each and can be paid via Debit/Credit when you arrive.

If you are not interested in getting a stencil printed at Vera, you can print your own on transparency at a FedEx or similar print service location.

2\. What if I need direct assistance on my projects?

Our moderators are trained to assist with any topics covered in the SP 101 class offered at Vera. While some may be able to give you basic advice on your project, they are not expected to ask as a direct instructor. If you have a project where you would like one-on-one guidance, please reach out to matt@theveraproject.org to request private tutoring.

3\. I really want to use your studio during an Open Session, but there are no slots available?

Our studio is in high demand, so we apologize if our Open Session is sold out — We have limited space in the studio and several events every day at Vera, so it can be difficult for us to find more time for Open Sessions. If you're interested in booking the studio outside of Open Sessions, please email matt@theveraproject.org to discuss private rental rates and availability.

data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
Get into VERA’s Recording Studio through this 2-hour workshop and studio orientation! Learn the studio infrastructure including, bootup, signalflow, patchbay setup, mixing desk operation, and basic Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) integration. During this session, participants will experiment with different ways of running signals from the live room to the computer. Some familiarity with Digital Audio Workstations (i.e. ProTools, Logic, Reaper, Ableton, etc.) is encouraged.

After taking this course, students who are new to studio recording should be ready for the multi-week Recording Studio Workshop Series, as well as having a better grounding for independent research. Students who are experienced with studio recording may be credentialed for volunteering at studio sessions.
data.description:
Get into VERA’s Recording Studio through this 2-hour workshop and studio orientation! Learn the studio infrastructure including, bootup, signalflow, patchbay setup, mixing desk operation, and basic Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) integration. During this session, participants will experiment with different ways of running signals from the live room to the computer. Some familiarity with Digital Audio Workstations (i.e. ProTools, Logic, Reaper, Ableton, etc.) is encouraged.

After taking this course, students who are new to studio recording should be ready for the multi-week Recording Studio Workshop Series, as well as having a better grounding for independent research. Students who are experienced with studio recording may be credentialed for volunteering at studio sessions.

Presented by The Vera Project.

Recommended for ages 14 - 99

data.raw_description:
In this 2-hour workshop, students will have a practical grasp on lighting concepts and console operation, learn about different lighting instruments, and gain hands-on experience programming lights for Vera’s mainstage. Participants of the class will also gain basic fundamental knowledge of working with artists and production staff to elevate the concert experience as a lighting engineer.

Complete this class to be eligible for Lighting Engineer volunteer shifts at Vera shows. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other production-related opportunities!
data.description:

Participants of the class will also gain basic fundamental knowledge of working with artists and production staff to elevate the concert experience as a lighting engineer.

Complete this class to be eligible for Lighting Engineer volunteer shifts at Vera shows. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other production-related opportunities!

Presented by The Vera Project.

Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.name: CL 101: Intro to Concert Lighting
data.address: 305 Harrison Street, Seattle, Washington 98109, United States

data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
Basics of Live Sound is a 2-hour introduction to live audio engineering and an orientation to Vera Project’s methods and equipment. Topics covered include an introduction to microphones and mic placement, signal paths, stands, cables, DI’s, snake, sub-snakes and etiquette for working with bands. This class is designed for both the novices and experts of all ages and will give an overview of signal flow and setting up small PAs, in addition to the basic requirements for being part of the Vera sound team at shows. Discover why the accommodating, open minded “Vera Attitude” of show production is appreciated worldwide!

This class is a prerequisite for advanced audio classes at Vera and Sound Runner shifts at Vera Project show. Each Live Sound class unlocks new audio engineering volunteer shifts at Vera and eventually paid opportunities in and outside of the venue. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other audio-related educational programs such as tours, field trips, and internships!

data.age_limit: This is an all ages event (Under 14 requires adult supervision)
data.raw_description:
This 2-hour, comprehensive hands-on class teaches you all the basics of screen printing at Vera’s shop: From coating and burning a screen, to pulling your very first print! Get comfortable with Vera's shop layout, equipment, and culture. Learn about techniques for creating screens, terminology, and more to create 1-color projects in the print shop. Students will walk away with the basic skills for screen printing 1-color paper prints, and their own print of a special Vera design, specific to the 101 class.

This class is a prerequisite for other screenprint classes at Vera and access to Open Sessions in Vera's studio. Open Sessions are moderated by members of Vera's Screenprint Committee, and can provide guidance to participants on their projects. Open Sessions are scheduled for three times a month in 4 hour intervals. Participants must pay and register for an Open Session in advance on Vera's website.

data.raw_description:
Do you dream of people wearing your artwork out on the streets? Want to make shirts for your friend’s music project? Level up your fabric printing experience and take home your own printed tote bag in this 3-hour intermediate-level fabric printing class! In this hands-on workshop, you’ll explore the use-cases for printing on fabric, practice properly setting up on the t-shirt press, and understand different types of fabrics and inks. Students will receive three tote bags to print on, or have the option to bring their own light-colored 100% cotton fabrics to practice on. Students will be printing a Vera specific design, exclusive to the 202 class.

*Students must complete Screenprint 101 before attending this class.*

data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
Creating a good monitor mix is one of the most important tasks for a live sound engineer to achieve. This advanced class will introduce you to digital mixing boards in a low pressure environment. Subjects will include an introduction to Vera’s stage monitors, the basic ‘ringing out’ of monitors, EQing, and setting levels. The use of these techniques will allow you to create a clear monitor mix that will help performers be at their best. After a person has completed the Mixing for Monitors class they are eligible to take on Monitor Engineer volunteer positions at Vera shows. *Students must complete Live Sound 101 to be eligible for this class.*

This class is a prerequisite for the Front of House Mixing class at Vera and Monitor Engineer shifts at Vera Project shows. Each Live Sound class unlocks new audio engineering volunteer shifts at Vera and eventually paid opportunities in and outside of the venue. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other audio-related educational programs such as tours, field trips, and internships.
data.description:
Creating a good monitor mix is one of the most important tasks for a live sound engineer to achieve. This advanced class will introduce you to digital mixing boards in a low pressure environment. Subjects will include an introduction to Vera’s stage monitors, the basic ‘ringing out’ of monitors, EQing, and setting levels. The use of these techniques will allow you to create a clear monitor mix that will help performers be at their best. After a person has completed the Mixing for Monitors class they are eligible to take on Monitor Engineer volunteer positions at Vera shows. *Students must complete Live Sound 101 to be eligible for this class.*

This class is a prerequisite for the Front of House Mixing class at Vera and Monitor Engineer shifts at Vera Project shows. Each Live Sound class unlocks new audio engineering volunteer shifts at Vera and eventually paid opportunities in and outside of the venue. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other audio-related educational programs such as tours, field trips, and internships.

Presented by The Vera Project.

Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.name: LS 202: Mixing for Monitors
data.address: 305 Harrison Street, Seattle, Washington 98109, United States

bundles.name: Open Sessions
bundles.description: Screen Print Open Sessions at The Vera Project's studio

data.age_limit: This is an All Ages event.
data.raw_description:
**\*You MUST take the SP 101: Intro to Vera's Screen Print Studio class before you can sign up for an Open Session\***

Vera’s screen print studio offers four-hour Open Sessions where individuals who have completed the introductory class may use our screen print lab to work on their own projects. Our Open Sessions are looked over by a volunteer moderator, who can provide you with advice and guidance for anything taught in our Screen Printing 101 class. We offer three different kinds of tickets at Open Sessions: Vacuum Table for paper and other flat media, T-shirt Press for shirts, tote bags and other fabrics, and Screen prep for just screen preparation. Each ticket is limited to two. If the ticket you are looking for is sold out, please add yourself to the waitlist so you can be notified when a ticket becomes available.

For Open Sessions, Vera provides:

- Rentable screens
- Emulsion and emulsion remover
- Squegees
- Basic tools like spatulas, rulers, tape, etc.

Participants must provide their own:

- Substrate (paper, t-shirts, etc)
- Water based ink

Vera *does not* allow the use of non-water based inks at our studio, as our studio is not set up to safely process non-water based ink.

If you have any questions, please email matt@theveraproject.org.

**FAQ**

1\. Can Vera print a transparent stencil for me?

Yes — You must send us your stencil at least 24 hours before the start of your session. Your file must be a .PDF, no larger than 12" x 18", and ready to print. Vera cannot make any edits to your file. Stencils are $5 each and can be paid via Debit/Credit when you arrive.

If you are not interested in getting a stencil printed at Vera, you can print your own on transparency at a FedEx or similar print service location.

2\. What if I need direct assistance on my projects?

Our moderators are trained to assist with any topics covered in the SP 101 class offered at Vera. While some may be able to give you basic advice on your project, they are not expected to ask as a direct instructor. If you have a project where you would like one-on-one guidance, please reach out to matt@theveraproject.org to request private tutoring.

3\. I really want to use your studio during an Open Session, but there are no slots available?

Our studio is in high demand, so we apologize if our Open Session is sold out — We have limited space in the studio and several events every day at Vera, so it can be difficult for us to find more time for Open Sessions. If you're interested in booking the studio outside of Open Sessions, please email matt@theveraproject.org to discuss private rental rates and availability.

data.raw_description:
Interested in learning more about synthesizers and how to develop your own synthesized sounds In this informative 2-hour workshop, our instructor will provide you with a detailed breakdown of the history of synthesis, Audio Path, Modulation, Basic Subtractive Patching, and more!

\*The use of a laptop is required to participate in this class. You will need to download VCV (free on laptops). Vera has a limited amount of laptops that we can provide on a first-come-first-serve basis to our members. If you do have your own laptop, we would appreciate if you used your own, so we can provide laptops to those who may not have one. If you would like to request a laptop, please email yewon.k@theveraproject.org. You will also need to download a couple files for this workshop. These files will be sent 24 hours before the class.
data.description:
Interested in learning more about synthesizers and how to develop your own synthesized sounds In this informative 2-hour workshop, our instructor will provide you with a detailed breakdown of the history of synthesis, Audio Path, Modulation, Basic Subtractive Patching, and more!

\*The use of a laptop is required to participate in this class. You will need to download VCV (free on laptops). Vera has a limited amount of laptops that we can provide on a first-come-first-serve basis to our members. If you do have your own laptop, we would appreciate if you used your own, so we can provide laptops to those who may not have one. If you would like to request a laptop, please email yewon.k@theveraproject.org. You will also need to download a couple files for this workshop. These files will be sent 24 hours before the class.

Presented by The Vera Project.

This is an All Ages event.
data.name: SY 101: Intro to Synthesis
data.address: 305 Harrison Street, Seattle, Washington 98109, United States

data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
Basics of Live Sound is a 2-hour introduction to live audio engineering and an orientation to Vera Project’s methods and equipment. Topics covered include an introduction to microphones and mic placement, signal paths, stands, cables, DI’s, snake, sub-snakes and etiquette for working with bands. This class is designed for both the novices and experts of all ages and will give an overview of signal flow and setting up small PAs, in addition to the basic requirements for being part of the Vera sound team at shows. Discover why the accommodating, open minded “Vera Attitude” of show production is appreciated worldwide!

This class is a prerequisite for advanced audio classes at Vera and Sound Runner shifts at Vera Project show. Each Live Sound class unlocks new audio engineering volunteer shifts at Vera and eventually paid opportunities in and outside of the venue. Become a volunteer at Vera to access other audio-related educational programs such as tours, field trips, and internships!

This class is designed for both the novices and experts of all ages and will give an overview of signal flow and setting up small PAs, in addition to the basic requirements for being part of the Vera sound team at shows. Discover why the accommodating, open minded “Vera Attitude” of show production is appreciated worldwide!

Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.name: LS 101: Basics of Live Sound
data.address: 305 Harrison Street, Seattle, Washington 98109, United States

data.age_limit: This is an all ages event (Under 14 requires adult supervision)
data.raw_description:
This 2-hour, comprehensive hands-on class teaches you all the basics of screen printing at Vera’s shop: From coating and burning a screen, to pulling your very first print! Get comfortable with Vera's shop layout, equipment, and culture. Learn about techniques for creating screens, terminology, and more to create 1-color projects in the print shop. Students will walk away with the basic skills for screen printing 1-color paper prints, and their own print of a special Vera design, specific to the 101 class.

This class is a prerequisite for other screenprint classes at Vera and access to Open Sessions in Vera's studio. Open Sessions are moderated by members of Vera's Screenprint Committee, and can provide guidance to participants on their projects. Open Sessions are scheduled for three times a month in 4 hour intervals. Participants must pay and register for an Open Session in advance on Vera's website.

data.raw_description:
Interested in learning more about DJ-ing? In this 3-hour crash course, students will learn the ins-and-outs of Serato, playing and mixing tracks, finessing your tracks, and general tips and tricks for digital DJ-ing.

\*Use of a laptop is required to take part in this class — Vera has a limited number of laptops available to borrow for membership. If you need one to participate, please email yewon.k@theveraproject.org to confirm our availability.

\*Use of a laptop is required to take part in this class — Vera has a limited number of laptops available to borrow for membership. If you need one to participate, please email yewon.k@theveraproject.org to confirm our availability.

data.name: DJ 101: Intro to DJ-ing
data.address: 305 Harrison Street, Seattle, Washington 98109, United States

data.age_limit: Recommended for ages 14 - 99
data.raw_description:
Get into VERA’s Recording Studio through this 2-hour workshop and studio orientation! Learn the studio infrastructure including, bootup, signalflow, patchbay setup, mixing desk operation, and basic Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) integration. During this session, participants will experiment with different ways of running signals from the live room to the computer. Some familiarity with Digital Audio Workstations (i.e. ProTools, Logic, Reaper, Ableton, etc.) is encouraged.

After taking this course, students who are new to studio recording should be ready for the multi-week Recording Studio Workshop Series, as well as having a better grounding for independent research. Students who are experienced with studio recording may be credentialed for volunteering at studio sessions.
data.description:
Get into VERA’s Recording Studio through this 2-hour workshop and studio orientation! Learn the studio infrastructure including, bootup, signalflow, patchbay setup, mixing desk operation, and basic Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) integration. During this session, participants will experiment with different ways of running signals from the live room to the computer. Some familiarity with Digital Audio Workstations (i.e. ProTools, Logic, Reaper, Ableton, etc.) is encouraged.

After taking this course, students who are new to studio recording should be ready for the multi-week Recording Studio Workshop Series, as well as having a better grounding for independent research. Students who are experienced with studio recording may be credentialed for volunteering at studio sessions.

Presented by The Vera Project.

Recommended for ages 14 - 99
